DataElement.preferredName: Serious Adverse Event Prior Therapy Relationship Current Reporting Period Occurrence Yes No Coded Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric code to signify whether any prior therapies were associated with serious adverse events occurring in the current reporting period.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Serious Adverse Event Prior Therapy Relationship Current Reporting Period Occurrence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any expected or unexpected adverse event, related or unrelated to the intervention, occurring at any agent dose, any phase of product or procedure testing, that results in any of the following outcomes: death, a life-threatening adverse event, requires inpatient hospitalization (not required as part of the treatment) or prolongation of existing hospitalization, a persistent or significant disability or incapacity, or cancer, or a congenital anomaly or birth defect. Important medical events that may not result in the listed outcomes may be considered as serious when, based upon appropriate medical judgment, they represent significant hazards or potentially serious harm to the research subject or others and may require medical intervention to prevent one of the outcomes listed in this definition._An indicator that a person has been previously treated for the same condition or with the same therapy._A state of connectedness between people, objects, or events; to be associated or connected with something._Occurring in or belonging to the present time._The act of providing a short account._An interval of time._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Serious Adverse Event Prior Therapy Relationship
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any expected or unexpected adverse event, related or unrelated to the intervention, occurring at any agent dose, any phase of product or procedure testing, that results in any of the following outcomes: death, a life-threatening adverse event, requires inpatient hospitalization (not required as part of the treatment) or prolongation of existing hospitalization, a persistent or significant disability or incapacity, or cancer, or a congenital anomaly or birth defect. Important medical events that may not result in the listed outcomes may be considered as serious when, based upon appropriate medical judgment, they represent significant hazards or potentially serious harm to the research subject or others and may require medical intervention to prevent one of the outcomes listed in this definition.:An indicator that a person has been previously treated for the same condition or with the same therapy.:A state of connectedness between people, objects, or events; to be associated or connected with something.

Concepts.definition: Any expected or unexpected adverse event, related or unrelated to the intervention, occurring at any agent dose, any phase of product or procedure testing, that results in any of the following outcomes: death, a life-threatening adverse event, requires inpatient hospitalization (not required as part of the treatment) or prolongation of existing hospitalization, a persistent or significant disability or incapacity, or cancer, or a congenital anomaly or birth defect. Important medical events that may not result in the listed outcomes may be considered as serious when, based upon appropriate medical judgment, they represent significant hazards or potentially serious harm to the research subject or others and may require medical intervention to prevent one of the outcomes listed in this definition.
Prior action or administration of therapeutic agents that produced an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
A state of connectedness between people, objects, or events; to be associated or connected with something.

Property.preferredDefinition: Occurring in or belonging to the present time.:The act of providing a short account.:An interval of time.:An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

Concepts.definition: Occurring in or belonging to the present time.
The act of providing a short account.
An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Yes or No response to a question coded as 1 (Yes) or 2 (No).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.29 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated to add NCIt concept relationship. Updated VM Short Name to be the Public ID to be consistent with current convention for VM Short Name - DW 10-03-2022
ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.29 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. ak

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Are there prior therapies ass
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are there prior therapies associated with any serious events occurring this reporting period?
